meaningMnemonic: Your <kanji>see</kanji>ing is <kanji>return</kanji>ing on something. This verb can be both transitive and intransitive. When it’s transitive, it means <vocabulary>to look back at</vocabulary>, in the sense of looking back at someone who’s behind you, or looking back at your past. When it’s intransitive, it simply means <vocabulary>to look back</vocabulary>, in the sense of looking over your shoulder.
readingMnemonic: The readings are just 見 and the vocab word 返る, combined together. So long as you know both of those you should be able to combine them into the reading for this word.
